p: The early success of WGS and WES approaches has been in the area of identifying the cause of highly penetrant monogenic PD [ 26â€“ 28]. Certainly these approaches afford a more complete and much more rapid detection of the genetic causes of rare familial forms of disease. The expansion of these efforts into more population based approaches is underway [ 29]. These data are easily shared across sites, particularly using cloud-based infrastructure. Such sharing not only increases the power to detect genetic variants of interest but also serves to produce a reference PD dataset that the field as a whole can use.
